item.title: 国际金融公司和 BTG Pactual 将为拉丁美洲的可持续发展投资高达 10 亿美元
item.description: 巴西贷款公司 BTG Pactual 和世界银行的私营部门机构国际金融公司周四宣布，将联合投资 10 亿美元，用于可持续发展和发展计划。【原文：Brazilian lender BTG Pactual and the World Bank's private sector arm International Finance Corporation announced on Thursday up to $1 billion in joint investments on sustainability and development initiatives.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Meta 公司的扎克伯格在关税威胁前就数字税问题向特朗普施压
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周四援引熟悉这次私人会面的人士的话报道称，Meta Platforms 首席执行官马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）上周拜访了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump），讨论数字服务税的威胁。【原文：Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg had visited U.S. President Donald Trump last week to discuss the threat of digital service taxes, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the private meeting.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局称纽瓦克机场因电信问题停飞航班
item.description: 电信频率中断导致联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）周四将抵达纽瓦克自由国际机场的航班停飞一个多小时，这是纽约市附近机场航班受阻的最新一次技术问题。【原文：A telecom frequency outage prompted the Federal Aviation Administration Thursday to halt arriving flights at Newark Liberty International Airport for more than an hour, the latest tech issue to snarl flights at the airport near New York City.】

item.title: 新日铁寄望 110 亿美元投资和技术转让提升美国钢铁公司利润
item.description: 日本新日铁公司的一位高级管理人员表示，该公司计划通过投资 110 亿美元以及转让其运营技巧和先进技术来扩大产能和增加更多高档产品，从而增加美国钢铁公司的利润。【原文：Japan's Nippon Steel plans to increase profit at U.S. Steel through an $11 billion investment and the transfer of its operational techniques and advanced technologies to expand capacity and add more high-grade products, a senior executive said.】

item.title: CD Projekt 公司上半年净利润下降 9
item.description: 波兰最大的游戏开发商 CD Projekt 周四报告称，由于销售成本上升和纳税增加，半年净利润同比下降了 8.9%。【原文：Poland's biggest game developer CD Projekt on Thursday reported an 8.9% fall in half-year net profit compared with the previous year due to higher selling costs and paying more tax.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，耐克将裁员约 1%，以实现扭亏为盈
item.description: 据 CNBC 周四援引公司声明报道，耐克正计划裁员约 1%，因为这家鞋业巨头正努力在首席执行官埃利奥特-希尔的领导下实现扭亏为盈。【原文：Nike is planning on cutting about 1% of its corporate workforce as the footwear giant works towards a turnaround under CEO Elliott Hill, CNBC reported on Thursday, citing a company statement.】

item.title: 福特南非汽车和发动机厂将裁员超过 470 人
item.description: 南非团结工会（South African Solidarity union）周四表示，福特汽车南非分公司计划裁员 470 多人，以调整产能，满足当前和未来的市场需求。【原文：Ford Motor's South African unit plans to lay off more than 470 employees as it seeks to adjust production capacity to match current and future market demands, the South African Solidarity union said on Thursday.】

item.title: 英特尔首席财务官称，根据特朗普协议，芯片制造商已收到 57 亿美元未兑现的 CHIPS 法案补助金
item.description: 英特尔公司首席财务官大卫-津斯纳（David Zinsner）周四在加利福尼亚州举行的德意志银行科技会议上表示，"昨晚 "英特尔公司收到了《CHIPS 法案》中尚未兑现的 57 亿美元拨款，这笔款项将转为美国政府在这家陷入困境的芯片制造商中的股份。【原文：Intel received the $5.7 billion in outstanding grants from the CHIPS Act that is being converted into the U.S. government's stake in the struggling chipmaker "last night," Chief Financial Officer David Zinsner said at a Deutsche Bank tech conference in California on Thursday.】

item.title: NBC 环球与亚马逊达成协议，将孔雀视频引入 Prime Video 频道
item.description: 康卡斯特旗下的 NBC 环球公司与亚马逊达成协议，将在《Peacock》的无广告版中加入 Prime Video 频道，这也是流媒体服务首次作为在线零售商数字频道套餐的一部分提供。【原文：Comcast-owned NBCUniversal, and Amazon have reached a deal to bring the ad-free version of Peacock to Prime Video Channels, the first time the streaming service has been offered as part of the online retailer's package of digital channels.】

item.title: 欧盟提议取消对美国进口汽车的关税，以加快降低美国汽车关税的步伐
item.description: 欧盟委员会周四提议取消对进口美国工业产品的关税，这是与美国达成的贸易协议的一部分，该协议应导致美国追溯性地降低对欧洲汽车的关税。【原文：The European Commission proposed on Thursday removing tariffs on imported U.S. industrial goods, part of a trade agreement with the United States that should result in a retroactive lowering of U.S. tariffs on European cars.】

item.title: 消息人士称，菲利普斯 66 将于下周开始关闭洛杉矶地区的炼油厂
item.description: 据知情人士透露，菲利普斯 66 将于 9 月份开始关闭其位于洛杉矶地区的日产量达 13.9 万桶的炼油厂。【原文：Phillips 66 will begin shuttering its 139,000 barrel-per-day (bpd) Los Angeles-area refinery in September, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 金-哈维被任命为《哥伦比亚广播公司晚间新闻》执行制片人
item.description: 派拉蒙旗下的哥伦比亚广播公司（CBS）新闻周四任命资深广播和有线电视新闻记者金-哈维（Kim Harvey）担任其旗舰晚间新闻节目《哥伦比亚广播公司晚间新闻》（CBS Evening News）的首席制片人，使她成为执掌这一拥有 77 年历史的广播节目的第二位女性。【原文：Paramount's CBS News on Thursday named veteran broadcast and cable news journalist Kim Harvey as top producer of its flagship nightly newscast, "CBS Evening News", making her only the second woman to helm the 77-year-old broadcast.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行：投资者远离美国，欧洲对冲基金受青睐
item.description: 法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas）周四向客户发送的一份调查报告显示，随着富裕的金融家从美国分散投资，自2023年以来，投资者首次计划增加对冲基金对欧洲和亚洲的投资，而不是美国。【原文：Investors plan to increase their hedge fund exposure to prefer Europe and Asia over the U.S. for the first time since 2023 as wealthy financiers diversify away from the United States, a BNP Paribas survey sent to clients on Thursday showed.】

item.title: 烈酒制造商帝亚吉欧将于 2026 年 2 月关闭安大略装瓶厂
item.description: 全球最大的烈酒生产商帝亚吉欧公司周四表示，作为改善北美供应链努力的一部分，该公司将在 2026 年 2 月前关闭位于加拿大安大略省的一家皇冠皇家威士忌装瓶厂。【原文：Diageo will shut one of its Crown Royal whisky bottling facilities in Ontario, Canada by February 2026, as part of efforts to improve North American supply chain, the world's largest spirits maker said on Thursday.】

item.title: Stellantis 延长历史悠久的意大利都灵工厂的缩短工时计划
item.description: 汽车制造商 Stellantis 周四与工会签署协议，将其位于意大利北部历史悠久的 Mirafiori 工厂的工人缩短工时计划延长五个月。【原文：Automaker Stellantis on Thursday signed a deal with unions to extend for five months a reduced working hours scheme for workers at its historic Mirafiori plant in northern Italy.】

item.title: 美国 7 月成屋销售放缓
item.description: 由于抵押贷款利率上升和劳动力市场放缓，潜在房主望而却步，7 月份美国旧房购买合同降幅超过预期。【原文：Contracts to buy previously owned U.S. homes fell more than expected in July as higher mortgage rates and a slowing labor market sidelined prospective homeowners.】

item.title: Framer 在最新一轮融资中估值达到 20 亿美元
item.description: 网站设计平台 Framer 周四表示，它在最新一轮融资中筹集了 1 亿美元，估值达到 20 亿美元。【原文：Website design platform Framer said on Thursday it had notched a valuation of $2 billion while raising $100 million in its latest funding round.】

item.title: 沃尔格林任命迈克-莫茨为首席执行官，在 Sycamore Partners 旗下实现私有化
item.description: 在美国连锁药店被 Sycamore Partners 私有化后，沃尔格林周四任命零售业资深人士迈克-莫茨（Mike Motz）为首席执行官，这标志着这家一直在努力追赶竞争对手的公司翻开了新的篇章。【原文：Walgreens on Thursday named retail veteran Mike Motz as chief executive after the U.S. pharmacy chain was taken private by Sycamore Partners, marking a fresh chapter for the company that has been struggling to keep pace with rivals.】

item.title: 美国第二季度企业利润反弹；GDP 增长率上调
item.description: 美国企业利润在第二季度出现反弹，但进口关税正在提高企业成本，这可能会限制企业利润的进一步增长，并阻碍经济增长。【原文：U.S. corporate profits rebounded in the second quarter, but tariffs on imports are raising costs for businesses, which could limit further gains and hamper economic growth.】

item.title: 极光公司与麦克劳德软件公司合作管理自主卡车运输
item.description: 极光创新公司（Aurora Innovation）与麦克劳德软件公司（McLeod Software）周四表示，将把其自动驾驶卡车平台整合到麦克劳德软件公司的运输管理系统中，以促进自动驾驶技术的应用。【原文：Aurora Innovation will integrate its self-driving trucking platform into McLeod Software's transportation management system in an effort to boost adoption, the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 杰克丹尼尔制造商布朗-福尔曼（Brown-Forman）季度销售额增长
item.description: 杰克丹尼尔酒生产商布朗-福尔曼公司（Brown-Forman）周四公布的第一季度销售额超出华尔街预期，原因是市场对其即饮饮料和烈酒的需求稳定。【原文：Jack Daniel's maker Brown-Forman beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter sales on Thursday, on the back of steady demand for its ready-to-drink beverages and spirits.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数下降，裁员人数减少
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数有所下降，但不温不火的招聘可能会使 8 月份的失业率升至 4.3%。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for jobless benefits fell last week, but tepid hiring could raise the unemployment rate to 4.3% in August.】

item.title: 英国阿斯达公司警告称，沃尔玛 IT 分离完成后销售额将受到冲击
item.description: 英国第三大超市集团阿斯达（Asda）周四表示，由于与前所有者沃尔玛（Walmart）系统分离的重大 IT 改造进入最后阶段，本季度的销售额将受到影响。【原文：Asda, Britain’s third-largest supermarket group, said on Thursday that sales in its current quarter would be dented by disruption linked to the final phase of a major IT overhaul separating its systems from former owner Walmart .】

item.title: 由于商品成本上升，荷美尔食品公司季度利润低于预期
item.description: Skippy 花生酱生产商荷美尔食品公司（Hormel Foods）周四预计本季度利润低于预期，此前该公司第三季度盈利因商品成本上升而不及预期，导致其股价在盘前交易中下跌约 7%。【原文：Skippy peanut butter maker Hormel Foods forecast lower-than-expected profit for the ongoing quarter on Thursday, after missing third-quarter earnings estimates on higher commodity costs, sending its shares down about 7% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 供过于求，票价低迷，中国大型航空公司上半年持续亏损
item.description: 周四发布的财报显示，中国最大的两家航空公司上半年亏损收窄，但由于运力过剩导致票价持续走低，仍牢牢处于亏损状态，这凸显了该行业在大流行后复苏的脆弱性。【原文：China's two largest airlines narrowed their first-half losses but remained firmly in the red as a capacity surplus kept fares low, earnings reports released on Thursday showed, underscoring the fragility of the sector's post-pandemic recovery.】

item.title: 印度小企业争相缓冲特朗普征收 50%关税的打击
item.description: 数以万计的印度小企业正争先恐后地在欧洲、非洲和亚洲市场寻找新的买家，以减轻本周三生效的对美国出口征收 50%关税的影响。【原文：Tens of thousands of Indian small businesses are scrambling to find new buyers in markets across Europe, Africa and Asia to dull the impact of a 50% tariff on exports to the U.S. that took effect on Wednesday.】

item.title: 对英伟达喜忧参半的前景和中国不确定性的反应
item.description: 面对华盛顿和中国政府之间的贸易战，人工智能芯片巨头英伟达（Nvidia）将部分中国销售额排除在本季度业绩指引之外，这让习惯了大幅预测的投资者产生了分歧。【原文：Nvidia investors accustomed to blowout forecasts were left divided after the AI chip giant excluded some China sales from its current-quarter guidance in the face of a trade war between Washington and Beijing.】

item.title: 福特因制动液泄漏召回近 50 万辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周四表示，福特汽车公司因制动液泄漏问题在美国召回近50万辆汽车。【原文：Ford Motor is recalling nearly 500,000 vehicles in the U.S over a brake fluid leak issue, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday.】

item.title: Bath & Body Works 因成本压力而季度利润不佳
item.description: Bath & Body Works 周四公布的第二季度利润不及华尔街预期，原因是该零售商正努力应对不确定的可自由支配的消费支出，但却受到成本上升的影响。【原文：Bath & Body Works missed Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit on Thursday, hurt by higher costs at a time when the retailer grapples with uncertain discretionary consumer spending.】

item.title: 由于对廉价生活必需品的需求强劲，Dollar General 上调了年度目标
item.description: 美元通用公司（Dollar General）周四上调了年度销售额和利润预期，在关税和通胀忧虑的背景下，该公司寄希望于美国各收入阶层注重成本的消费者的稳定需求。【原文：Dollar General raised its annual sales and profit forecasts on Thursday, banking on steadfast demand from cost-conscious consumers across income brackets in the United States amid tariff and inflation concerns.】
